Yeah, especialy the fact that you replied to the wrong person, the fact that she can use her Q to last hit untill hell freezes over thus stacking her permastun passive for free, and the fact that her ult is an insta-aoe-dps-point and click nuke. 

She is basicaly the garen of mid lane.

SO MUCH DIFFICULTY, MUH PLAYZ.
Hey, Garen takes way more skill than Annie. You gotta have the skill to shout "DEMACIA" at the screen whenever you do anything. Takes some serious lung power, that...
Screaming demacia is a quadrillion times better than screaming tibbers with the voice and accent of a 4 year old girl, if you ask me.

Being.. close..? She has 600 range on her Q and W and her R has a 600 BASE range with a 290 RADIUS, meaning it stuns up to 890 away from herself. If you call that close range, you must think every ADC is short ranged 'cause only Cait and Trist can have more than 600 passively and only three champions, Kog, Jinx, and Twitch, can get passed 600 with an ability usage. All the others are... really short. Like Lucian is at, what, 500? Varus is at 575, Quinn at 525, Vayne at 550, Draven at 600, Ashe at 600, Corki at 550, Ez at 550 (1150 Q though), MF at 550, Graves at 525... Like, seriously. lol. 

Just because we have Seigers like Ziggs (850 range on the Q, bouncing up to 1400) and Xerath (750-1400 based on charge time) doesn't mean Annie is all of a sudden short range since most require you to be in her range to do anything to her with the exception of poke mages that she just flashes and instagibs. If you gotta be in her range to do anything to her, then considering her to be 'close ranged' isn't much of a punishment since she bursts harder than any melee assassin. Even Kat and Talon can't burst as hard as Annie while still having the CC to set that kill up.

One of the biggest issues everyone has always had with Annie compared to every Assassin ever is that every other Assassin, even short ranged ones, have had their CC removed because 'Muh counterplay', yet Annie still stands strong with the same amount of burst on relatively short cool downs and almost 0 mana problems.
Sorry, I don't consider a champ "close range" just because you die if you get close to her.

People keep picking Nasus into my Shen. So I take Teleport and fly all over the map. Yes, Nasus takes my tower and gets stacks. But my team is fed so then we just steamroll while I peel Nasus. Team-orientation >> Farm-orientation.

Nasus powerspike is actually around the mid game since then he is the best at teamfighting since then he is usually tanky enough to take quite a bit of damage while still dealing good damage... but as the game goes on the ADC and APC damage tend to just get better and better (and damage generally scales better then defense in that items are generally slightly more expensive but also stronger per item)

Though of course he is pretty much always good at split pushing and 1v1 (given he has gotten a good/decent amount of stacks and is able to get to his target)
I think people also overlook that by the endgame people max their utility skills too, which means lower cooldowns and even more kiting.

I don't like playing Nasus like that. I play him a bit differently but it's very stupid. See I go into a game as Nasus with the mindset of "I have a very limited amount of time to make sure my Q has damage". Until the teamfights start and the lane phase ends I am stacking as much as I can taking harass in exchange for stacks ect.. But when the teamfights start I am the first to rush in (I build tank Nasus) and take hits and get the carries while my team does the rest. Basically I farm for just enough time for my Q to be a THREAT, not necessarily a monster.

> [{quoted}](name=ElJanitorFrank,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Fg2WgLFa,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2015-06-04T05:55:07.092+0000)

Yes. You have to prevent him from farming and if you can't, you're dead.

> Yes. You have to prevent him from farming and if you can't, you're dead.




So he's like every other champion in league?

Nasus has the same problem as Darius, he's extremely vulnerable to ganks.  If nobody comes to gank for you pre-6, you're handing the game to Nasus.  Obviously you can gank anybody pre-6 and put them behind, but Nasus is _extremely_ vulnerable to it.

He has few weaknesses, but his biggest one is getting ganked, and it's super easy to do.

I played Xin top against a nasus about 4 games ago. i had 3 kills on him and dropped his tower at about 15 minute mark. i then started roaming and picked up a kill and assist before realizing nasus had dropped my first top tower and was working on the second.

I pushed him off and shoved out lane, only to have him come back and try to take tower again. from there i literally almost couldnt even team fight because nasus never left the lane unless he died.

there were a few occassions where he left top, but only so he could solo push out bot until someone found him and ran him off again. with his frozen heart and all his free stacks he was winning all 1v1 exchanges even though i crushed him early game due to his armor and Q. It was just plain bullshit to play against because he just played farmville all damn game long until i finally had enough damage and armor pen to be able to kill himself and hold the lanes against him, but it essentailly destroyed all good team fights for the game since he never joined unless the team happened to just be with him.

Sometimes nasus is just plain toxic to play against because he's only ever about his stacks and it requires you to dedicate atleast one person on your team to just baby sitting him so he cant get free stacks and towers all game.

That is split pushing in general, not Nasus.

If you want a tip, engage on their team 5v4.  You win the teamfight, and from that point you can hunt down Nasus in a 5v1, or push mid, much faster than Nasus can push a side lane.
